/**
 * @deprecated
 *
 * - This field will be always set to true after removal. True to have the sharing link redeem fallback in case the Trees Latest/Redeem 1RT call fails with redeem error. During fallback it will first redeem the sharing link and then make the Trees latest call.
 */
members.name: enableRedeemFallback
enableShareLinkWithCreate

 * - This will be replaced with feature gate snapshotFormatFetchType. Policy controlling if we want to fetch binary format snapshot.
 */
members.name: fetchBinarySnapshotFormat

sessionOptions

file

members.docComment:
/**
 * @deprecated
 *
 * - Due to security reasons we will passing the token via Authorization header only. Value indicating session preference to always pass access token via Authorization header. Default behavior is to pass access token via query parameter unless overall href string length exceeds 2048 characters. Using query param is performance optimization which results in ODSP XHR request being treated as 'simple' request which do not require OPTIONS call to validate CORS. However, not all ODSP implementations understand this optimization. For instance, auth layer on Converged stack will fail request with access token passed via query param.
 */
members.name: forceAccessTokenViaAuthorizationHeader

IEntry

members.docComment:
/**
 * Get the cache value of the key
 *
 * @param entry - cache entry, identifies file and particular key for this file.
 *
 * @returns Cached value. undefined if nothing is cached.
 */
members.name: get

members.docComment:
/**
 * Put the value into cache. Important - only serializable content is allowed since this cache may be persisted between sessions
 *
 * @param entry - cache entry.
 *
 * @param value - JSON-serializable content.
 */
members.name: put

members.docComment:
/**
 * Removes the entries from the cache for given parametres.
 *
 * @param file - file entry to be deleted.
 */
members.name: removeEntries

members.docComment:
/**
 * Helper method which returns flag indicating whether token response comes from local cache
 *

 */

/**
 * Method signature for callback method used to fetch access token
 *
 * @param options - token fetch options
 *
 * @returns If successful, TokenResponse object representing token value along with flag indicating whether token came from cache. Legacy implementation may return a string for token value; in this case it should be assumes that fromCache signal is undefined. Null is returned in case of failure.
 */
members.name: TokenFetcher
TokenFetchOptions

refresh
tenantId

 */
members.name: tokenFromResponse
